domainEnrichment: filter domains by background domain count => foldEnrichmentDist => foldEnrichmentPval => pval correction => plot pvals => plot the distribution for a set of random proteins

domainEnrichment.Rd

domainEnrichment: filter domains by background domain count => foldEnrichmentDist => foldEnrichmentPval => pval correction => plot pvals => plot the distribution for a set of random proteins

domainEnrichment(backgr_domain_count, all.data, net, protein_annot, data,
  N = 1000, cores = NULL, seed = 1, frequency = T,
  proteinID = sample(unique(net$IDs_interactor_viral), 6),
  pValPlot = "Pval", remove_zeros = F, calculate_qval = F)

Arguments

backgr_domain_count

discard domains that have background count of less or equal backgr_domain_count
all.data

data.table: all data (net + protein_annot + data) + additional columns, domain_count is necessary for the function to work
net

data.table that specifies the PPI network: 1. first column specifies a protein ("IDs_interactor_viral") 2. second column specifies it's interacting partner which annotations are of interest ("IDs_interactor_human") 3. third column specifies the degree of a protein in the first column ("IDs_interactor_viral_degree")
protein_annot

data.table that specifies annotations for a protein in the second column of net 1. first column specifies a protein ("IDs_interactor_human") 2. second column specifies features of that protein ("IDs_domain_human") 3. third column specifies background frequency of those features ("domain_frequency)
data

data.table containing foldEnrichment value for each protein-feature pair (4 columns: IDs_interactor_viral, IDs_interactor_human, IDs_domain_human, fold_enrichment)
N

number of times to run permutation of PPI network
cores

specify how many cores to use for parallel processing, default (NULL) is to detect all cores on the machine and use all minus one. When using LSF cluster you must specify the number of cores to use because detectCores doen't know how much cores you have requested from LSF (with bsub -n) and detects all cores on the actual physical node.
seed

seed for RNG for reproducible sampling
frequency

logical, choice of statistic: fold enrichment or frequency in a set (if TRUE - frequency)
proteinID

protein ID for which to plot sampled distributions
pValPlot

character specifying column name which contains p-values for histogram
remove_zeros

logical, remove zero domain proteins from distribution before calculating p-vals?
calculate_qval

logical, calculate q-value adjustment? Can fail if pvalue distribution is weird

Contents
